What are the key features of the Verus DeFi protocol, and how does it address issues such as miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing incentives to miners and stakers?

The Verus DeFi protocol is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that offers a range of features to ensure smooth and secure operations. Here are some of the key features of the Verus DeFi protocol:

**Liquidity Pools:** The Verus DeFi protocol allows for the creation of liquidity pools that are backed by a fractional percentage of currencies, ranging from 5% to 100%. This means that liquidity pools can be created with varying levels of backing, providing flexibility and customization options.

**Simultaneous Conversions and Pricing:** One of the key benefits of the Verus DeFi protocol is that it ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, which can occur when miners or other actors exploit their position to gain an unfair advantage.

**Incentives for Miners and Stakers:** The Verus DeFi protocol provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring that they are rewarded for their participation in the network. This helps to maintain a smooth consensus operation and enables fee conversion capabilities.

**Integrated Cross-Chain Bridge Protocols:** The Verus DeFi protocol integrates DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols. This allows for seamless connectivity and fee conversion capabilities across different blockchains.

**Launch Options:** The Verus DeFi protocol also offers a range of launch options for new blockchains and bridge converters, including simultaneous blockchain and liquidity pool launches, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, and dual launches (blockchain and bridge). These launch options provide flexibility and customization options for developers and users.

Overall, the Verus DeFi protocol provides a robust and flexible framework for decentralized finance applications, addressing key issues such as MEV and front-running, while providing incentives to miners and stakers.

The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
### Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
### Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees.
